sentences.sContent: John and Bob complemented each other well.
sentences.sCn: 约翰和鲍勃互相配合得很好。

sentences.sContent: The dark red walls complement the red leather chairs.
sentences.sCn: 深红色的墙和红色的皮椅很相配。

remMethod.val: com(表加强) + ple(填满) + ment → 补充， 补足， 使完善

trans.tranCn: 补充， 补足， 使完善； 与…相配
trans.tranOther: to make a good combination with someone or something else

trans.tranCn: 补充物， 补足物； 足数， 足额； 补足语
trans.tranOther: someone or something that emphasizes the good qualities of another person or thing
